question: What is nasaq or kankut system?
option1: System in which revenue was fixed on the average yield of land assessed on the basis of past ten years.
option2: System in which produce was divided between the peasants and the state in fixed proportion.
option3: System in which rough appraisement on the basis of the inspection of the crops and past payments made by the village as a whole.
answer: System in which rough appraisement on the basis of the inspection of the crops and past payments made by the village as a whole.
explanation: In the nasaq or kankut a rough appraisement on the basis of the inspection of the crops and past payments made by the village as a whole whereas in the batais or ghallabakhshi the produce was divided between the peasants and the state in fixed proportion.
